Legal_Issue: Whether the National Parole Board's procedural rulings infringe the applicant's s. 7 Charter rights by denying the right to counsel, examination of clinical report authors, and exclusion of contested reports
Application_Facts: Applicant is serving an indeterminate sentence; liberty interest affected by Board's refusal to allow full counsel participation and expert examination; conflicting clinical reports
Decision_Outcome: Application allowed; matter referred back to the Board for rehearing with enhanced procedural protections
Court_Ruling: Section 7 requires enhanced procedural protections for dangerous offenders, including counsel assistance and examination of clinical report authors
Grounds_for_Claim: Denial of right to counsel, inability to examine authors of clinical reports, exclusion of contested reports
Legal_Standard: Section 7 of the Charter: life, liberty, and security of the person must be deprived in accordance with principles of fundamental justice
Assessment_Factor: Importance of informed decision-making in light of conflicting clinical evidence
Applicable_Legislation: Charter of Rights and Freedoms, s. 7; Corrections and Conditional Release Act
Procedural_Issue: Board's restrictions on counsel participation and handling of contested clinical reports
Review_Standard: Judicial review of administrative decision for compliance with Charter rights
Application_Basis: Liberty interest at stake due to indeterminate sentence and dangerous offender designation
Governing_Rule: Section 7 of the Charter requires fundamental justice, which may necessitate enhanced procedural fairness in dangerous offender hearings
Evidentiary_Deficiency: Inability to cross-examine authors of clinical reports
Outcome: Application allowed; remitted for rehearing with enhanced procedural protections
Harm_Assessment: Potential deprivation of liberty without sufficient procedural safeguards
Cause_Description: Parole hearing adjourned due to disputes over procedural rulings
Evidence_Handling: Contested clinical reports excluded; no opportunity for examination of authors
Evidence_Issues: Admissibility and examination of contested clinical reports
Evidence_Assessment: Need for proper presentation of factual matters through counsel and expert examination
Decision_Rationale: Enhanced procedural protections required under s. 7 to ensure fairness in dangerous offender proceedings without making hearings adversarial
Evidentiary_Issues: Exclusion of contested reports and lack of ability to examine report authors
Legal_Standard_Applied: Principles of fundamental justice under s. 7 of the Charter
